articles.pageTitle: Muslim Groom Outfit: Get the Utmost Style
articles.description: What does a Muslim groom wear? From thobes to embroidered sherwanis, discover how to coordinate with the bride.
articles.htmlBody:
What does a Muslim groom wear? Well, let's just say that his Muslim groom outfit is almost as important as the bridal dress. The pair will wear the same colors, or at least the same color of accents. But the groom's Muslim wedding attire will also reflect his personality with elegance and sophistication. Tuxedos are not dressy enough, by half! A Muslim groom outfit is showcased with nice thobes, shalwar kameez and embroidered sherwani. And layers are part of the blessed sunnah. So don’t forget the waistcoat.

Read further to create a memorable look that’s appropriate for the day.

The Right Muslim Groom Outfit: The Thobe

The thobe, also known as a dishdasha, is a traditional garment... For a Muslim groom outfit, the thobe can be elevated with the right accessories to create a distinguished and stylish look.

Thobe Design

To make it dressy, choose a cotton blend thobe that has a sateen finish...

Traditional Eastern Shoes for the Thobe

For an unexpected touch of flair, pair the thobe with traditional eastern shoes, such as khussa or mojari.

Matching a Turban with a Thobe

A topi or white imama won’t do for Muslim groom dress... The turban should help the bride and groom match in color.

Embroidered Waistcoat, Sherwani and Thobe

Adding a sherwani and vest to a thobe ensemble can create a polished and refined look.

Shalwar Kameez for the Muslim Groom Outfit

Like the thobe, shalwar kameez is a semi-dressy, but totally daily look... he can match a satin-finished shalwar kameez with a long sherwani.

Shalwar Kameez Design

Choose a shalwar kameez made from a heavy cotton... opt for rich colors like deep maroon, royal blue, or emerald green.

Long Sherwani and Kameez

A sherwani is a long coat-like garment... It adds a kingly touch to the Muslim groom wedding outfit.

Waistcoat Layered with Kameez and Sherwani

For classy layers, add a waistcoat under the sherwani.

Turban Matching the Sherwani

A matching turban is an essential accessory... adorn it with a brooch, feather or trailing jasmine flowers.

Muslim Groom Dress Shoes with a Kameez

Pair the shalwar kameez and sherwani with Western dress shoes for refined and elegant Islamic wedding wear.

The Go-To: Embroidered Sherwani for the Muslim Groom Outfit

The sherwani is a traditional, go-to garment... in South Asia, embroidered sherwanis for grooms are used very frequently.

Embroidered Sherwani Design

An embroidered wedding sherwani is usually of brocade or velvet. We’ve seen them in light green, red, gold and maroon.

The Best Turban for an Embroidered Sherwani

A sherwani is usually worn with a high, Indian-style, Muslim groom turban in a peacock style.

What About Accessories for the Muslim Groom Outfit?

  • Necklaces: Pearl or gold finished necklaces match the bride.
  • Flowers: Jasmine flowers to the back of your turban.
  • Ring: A ring with a nice stone makes you look regal.
  • Dupatta: A thin dupatta around the neck or a full woolen shawl.

Are you prepping for your wedding? Shop our Muslim Groom Outfits today.

Frequently Asked Questions

What does a Muslim groom wear?

A Muslim groom typically wears traditional garments that reflect elegance and modesty, such as a thobe, shalwar kameez, or an embroidered sherwani.
